channel.title: Comments on: Guild Wars Review: FiringSquad

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
That's kind of the problem with reviewing games. Difficult to review a medium that requires 20+ hours (50+?, >100?, years?) to fully consume. Reviewer has to do some sort of extrapolation or his/her review wouldn't see the light of day until months after release.
Particularly with Guild Wars, where the game really opens up in the teens and later.
item.content:encoded:
That’s kind of the problem with reviewing games. Difficult to review a medium that requires 20+ hours (50+?, >100?, years?) to fully consume. Reviewer has to do some sort of extrapolation or his/her review wouldn’t see the light of day until months after release.

Particularly with Guild Wars, where the game really opens up in the teens and later.

item.title: By: tratch
item.dc:creator: tratch
item.description: From the screenshots it looked like he was playing a monk and only made it to level 8 or something. I love my monk, but that's because I am used to being a support char. He's entitled to his opinion, but I think there's a reason why he found it boring.
item.content:encoded: From the screenshots it looked like he was playing a monk and only made it to level 8 or something. I love my monk, but that’s because I am used to being a support char. He’s entitled to his opinion, but I think there’s a reason why he found it boring.
